entries.name: patterns/idioms
entries.content:
# PHP Idioms

## Prefer strict types

Use `declare(strict_types=1);` in modern codebases.

## Use typed properties and return types

They improve clarity and static analysis.

entries.name: formatters/overview
entries.content:
# PHP Formatters

There is no official formatter; a common choice is PHP-CS-Fixer.

See: https://cs.symfony.com/

entries.name: spec
entries.content:
# PHP Language Reference
Version: unknown

Source: https://www.php.net/manual/en/langref.php


See: https://www.php.net/manual/en/langref.php

entries.name: linters/overview
entries.content:
# PHP Linters

PHP has no single official linter; popular choices include PHPStan and Psalm.

See:
- https://phpstan.org/
- https://psalm.dev/
